page.title: 12MARLEY HILL PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {MARLEY HILL PRIMARY SCHOOL}was built in 1895 on land given by the Earl of Strathmore.A farmer was paid Â£20 for loss of his turnip crop. The School was originally called Marley Hill Colliery School.It opened with 240 pupils The cost of the buildings were:-School Â£3081,School House Â£600, Fence around the school Â£80. Furniture cost Â£107. In 1964 the school was extended. Five rooms were added.These were the hall,indoor toilets for boys and girls, kitchen,and a classroom. In 1972, because of increasing numbers,a large classroom and double prefab were erected.In 1973 another double prefab was needed. The number of pupils has fallen by 1985 and spare classrooms are used for a television/music room,woodwork room, library and computer room.
